TopicTitle: What's the funniest thing you've ever built in KSP?

Articles.Content: What's the funniest thing you've built in KSP?
I stupidly huge winged nuclear powered space plane that never flew more than a couple of KM

Using novapunch 5m parts I made a spacestation/kethane refinery/fuel depot for beyond kerbin orbit. A huge beast with 4 large docking arms and I didn't want to bother with docking so I launched it in one piece. Oh,did I say that it was mobile with 4 nerva novapunch engines.

The Street Sweeper, a large boat/car that would manually clear the KSC of debris.

How 2 manually terminate debris:

1) Launch the Street Sweeper

2) Drive to the debris

3) Park directly over the target

4) Decouple a fuel tank (it holds 2)

5) Sepratrons will ignite

6) Fuel tank slams into the debris

Mission accomplished!

http://imgur.com/a/5taUY#0
I built a NSFW statue the other day when I was bored. I'm not too proud of myself, but it was pretty darn funny.

<iframe class="imgur-album" width="100%" height="550" frameborder="0" src="//imgur.com/a/Lq5mV/embed"></iframe>

New Hypetrain

Goofing around back in .23

You Will Go To Space Today by cantab314, on Flickr

In terms of sheer absurdity, my Duna return mission.

It became a fine example of mission creep. I literally could not get enough fuel out there to get a lander back, so ended up putting two fuel storage stations, three landers, and a kethane refinery system to create the fuel on-site to get them back home.
I wanted to test the thrust of the engines I got from Heavier rocketry so I put an Okto in a stack of them and blasted it into the sun in about 15 minutes
I don't have pics, but once I made a land-based aircraft carrier using B9 5 and some mod with monster wheels. It was the length of the width of the runway, but I never landed anything on it...
Belphegor: What is the thing with the orange tank and the lots of wheels, and how did you make the racing car's front wheels float ahead like that?
Was the name of that ship "Hole Driller"?

This was pretty..... interesting:

Oh, and this:

Edited September 13, 2014 by Random Tank

Currently building a 156-tonne 241-Kerbal FAR spaceliner in B9 and procedural wings that:

A: Is supermaneuverable in the technical definition of the term. It can do Kulbits and Pugachev's Cobra easily without using cockpit torque. This may cause severe nausea for Jeb's 240 unlucky victims.

B: Becomes more stable with speed. Yes, below mach 1, it is neutrally stable for a wide range of angles, but above mach 1, it's center of lift actually moves BACKWARD.

WOW. Without even adding a nuclear engine, the thing would be easily capable of a 1-way trip to Laythe with many tonnes of extra jet fuel to fly around on Laythe with (although it wouldn't need it to land, it is an amazing glider and can turn on a dime).

Edited September 7, 2014 by Pds314

I don't have pics, but once I made a land-based aircraft carrier using B9 5 and some mod with monster wheels. It was the length of the width of the runway, but I never landed anything on it...
